title: ICE on improperly implemented TryFrom

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Triaged
labels.description: Async-await issues that have been triaged during a working group meeting.

body:
`rustc lib.rs --edition=2018 --crate-type lib` produces an ICE for the code given below. This code should produce an error (the `TryFrom` implementation is missing associated items). ### Code **(UPDATED: Here's MCVE: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/74047#issuecomment-653879565)** ```Rust use std::convert::{TryFrom, TryInto}; use std::io; use std::os::unix::net::UnixStream; use std::path::Path; pub struct MyStream { } impl MyStream { pub async fn connect(path: impl AsRef) -> io::Result { let socket = Socket::new()?; let stream: MyStream = socket.into_unix_stream().try_into()?; loop {} } } impl TryFrom for MyStream { } pub struct Socket { } impl Socket { pub fn new() -> io::Result { loop {} } pub fn into_unix_stream(self) -> UnixStream { loop {} } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.44.1 (c7087fe00 2020-06-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: c7087fe00d2ba919df1d813c040a5d47e43b0fe7 commit-date: 2020-06-17 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.44.1 LLVM version: 9.0 ``` Error also occurs on beta and nightly. ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no entry found for key', src/librustc_mir_build/build/mod.rs:345:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.44.1 (c7087fe00 2020-06-17) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib error: internal compiler error: cat_expr Errd --> src/lib.rs:12:32 | 12 | let stream: MyStream = socket.into_unix_stream().try_into()?; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ error: internal compiler error: cat_expr Errd --> src/lib.rs:12:32 | 12 | let stream: MyStream = socket.into_unix_stream().try_into()?; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ error: internal compiler error: cat_expr Errd --> src/lib.rs:12:68 | 12 | let stream: MyStream = socket.into_unix_stream().try_into()?; | ^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:366:17 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f129fb65ab4 - backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace::h812748238d609e46 at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.46/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:86 1: 0x7f129fb65ab4 - 26: 0x7f129f9cf103 - __clone 27: 0x0 - error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.44.1 (c7087fe00 2020-06-17) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib thread panicked while panicking. aborting. Illegal instruction (core dumped) ```
